title: Getting Packet loss ( or some other in game issue )
body:
Lately I have been getting a lot of in game issues , Such as while playing my game will suddenly Freeze, ( Not DC but lag out ) for about 2 or maybe 1.5 seconds, then it pops back to normal. I do live in country area and use satellite connection, my ping is usually around 30-60 (In game), download speed at best is 4-5.50, but sometimes goes as low as 0.90, and upload speed is always around 0.90. I have played with my ping being 30-60, download speed at 5 and upload speed at 0.90 and it worked fine, but lately i have been getting a lot of issues. I also run at 60 FPS, so i dont know if the issue is my pc or my internet connection. I was thinking of getting a hotspot from 3G but don't know to much about it, i dont know if the issue is packet loss or what. Any help would be very appreciated.

Thank you.

replies.body:
This certainly does sound like packet loss, which is often caused by either local network settings or problems along your ISP routing to the server. I strongly recommend going through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your local network settings are 100% solid.

If you continue to have issues with this after taking those steps, we can take a look at your network routing to the servers.

Hi, so I have gone through the guide, many times, and done everything I can through my computer and router settings. I have fine ping and FPS through the entire game, but just moderate-severe packet loss. I just had a game as Syndra that I could barely play because I couldn't see where her orbs go and champions kept skipping. At one point I died to a Ziggs ult that I couldn't even see until after I was dead.

I've repaired the client, defrag'd my hard drive, even tried playing from a different computer. I have a wired connection and pay for better-than-average internet. This happens if I am the only device connected or if there are multiple devices online at one time.

And with how many people I have found that are having the same symptoms, I really don't think it's a localized issue to that many different computers/networks.  Is there any way you guys can look into this a little bit from your side?

If you've ensured your local network settings are aligned with our guide, then we'll want to take a look at your network routing to the servers. Running a traceroute should reveal where the issues are happening along the way to the servers. I'd like you to use a program called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) to complete the traceroute. Once you've opened the app, simply plug in **104.160.131.1** into the host IP/target address then start the trace. After the trace has run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you run into any issues completing that traceroute.

It looks like your packet loss starts on the first hop outside of your home network and continues along your entire path to the servers. I strongly recommend reaching out to a tier 2 support agent at your ISP and provide them this traceroute so they have additional context as to what's going on.

Let me know if you have any questions about this.

This is definitely packet loss, and I've been experiencing it about 50-66% of my games lately.  I'm not the only one either. I've cleaned up everything I can on my computer and even "repaired" the client (RIP all my custom item sets) and still have it.  Hoping RIOT is paying attention to this and can find a cause...
Has riot reported on the issue or anything? And thank you for clarifying. :)
Not that I've seen which is why I came here looking for posts from other people experiencing the same thing. Lol. I suppose we will have to submit support tickets to get their attention!
Thats why i'm here trying to see if anything official has been put out. Instead all I see are these canned messages.
The same thing is happening to me
